title: I'm done trying.
body:
I mained Swain, Vladimir, Kassadin, Aatrox.

Riot have ruined all my champions, Swains E is pathetic until ultra late an d it only worked because it stacked with all your damage, it's impossible to hit your enemy with Q now as it doesn't leash to the champion.

Try getting yasuo in a 4 second Q small aoe lol, when it leashed to him even if he dashed through you the Q would still be on you.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

They ruined vladimir, his empowerd Q does fraction more damage than what his old base Q just did all the time and the 1 second added to the cooldown totally destroys the champions ability to duel.

The E is insanely clunky and near impossible to hit even if u are in melee range of your enemy because of all the minions or other enemy champions, behind baron, behind dragon, when are you not clumped in all these things? It again is also a higher cooldown than even the level 1 old version.

The old E increased ur healing, allowing you to get off a devastatingly powerful summoners heal with spirit visage and the new masteries and your normal Q even healed FAR more than the current empowerd Q, even when you are about 5% hp.

They also uped the cooldown of your W and reduces its duration, stopping you from getting a second one off in the middle of a teamfight by zhonya's and flashing to postpone ur death to do it again

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Kassadins speaks for itself, he is still ok ULTRA lategame, but I'm talking 45 mins +

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now they are working to Destroy aatrox, and people there who have absolutely no experience with him (the commentors and the riot reworkers) are gonna sit and argue with me, someone who has years of experience on him.

Without these people doing basic math to see that aatrox with two full AD items heals more hp below 50% than this new aatrox will heal with 7900 hp at 1% health (missing health heal) count it yourself, compare his current and now.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For years I've preached to riot with the same suggestions for each one, and to revert the changes to the ones they have destroyed, with compelling reasons and facts, whilst others have also did the same and got many upvotes.

But it remains the same, they believe themselves infallible, absolute power corrupts absolutely.

> 
> He was a MARINE BIOLOGIST and he got his job, seriously what do you say to that? You speak from a position of ignorance and act like its enlightenment!

I always find this to be a strange response. Just to clarify, I have 18 years experience making video games, all with major franchises (Age of Empires, World of Warcraft, and now League of Legends). No, I did not study video games in university, but it's rare to find professional designers with a degree in game design even today, and those programs were non-existent nearly two decades ago. I was an oceanographer for only 8 years, and that's if you include 6 years of graduate school.

Our designers are a mix of relatively junior developers to seniors with years of experience at Riot or other game studios. The more junior designers are mentored and trained by the more experienced folks, as it is with virtually every software developer. All of them play League, have a lot of potential, and have a passion to improve the player experience, or else we wouldn't have hired them.

I'm fine if you disagree with any design decisions we are making, but it's not from lack of experience. :)

This comment is missing something...

https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7qDSOvfaCO9b3MlO/giphy.gif

There we go! Much better!

Seriously. Badmouth Ghostcrawler for his decisions and influences, sure...but including his background outside of the gaming industry is irrelevant and uncalled for. 

He's been in gaming for 10+ years. Experience isn't the issue. Its placating the cash-cows while the game rots underneath; kinda hard to pin that to Ghostcrawler, even. For all we know it could be 100% Tencent.
WAN HANDRED TENCENT

I have never understood the whole "X company has no clue what they're doing" when they are so successful. Clearly they have the slightest of inklings of what is going on. 

How in the world is Riot so incredibly successful with such incompetent people?? (Sarcasm)

Thats because some companies enter a market at the right time and their success is due to having a large potential customer base and very little competition. Riot was able to get a lock on the market. They didn't do it by doing anything that original, they did it by copying and piggybacking off others. They are successful because people love gaming. And if you are going to do competitive gaming you want to play where there are the most players. They are successful because we tolerate Riot and their success is based on selling RP, their entire business model depends on getting players to spend money on RP. So they rope people in by playing on their impatience or desire to win, by letting certain champions be OP, or purposely making new champions OP so people want to buy them imediately. This is a company with no integrity. Go research Marc Merill thoughts on eSports. Hes a total moron, which is why it takes the top 7 LOL tournament to equal the pay out of the top DOTA 2 tournament. These people aren't smart or genius. They are just average people who positioned themselves in a market at the right time, and unless they pull their head out of the asses, they are going to go the way of World of Warcraft.  Competition will arise, and they will either change how they do business or diminish.

Dude, you've got to be trolling. 

WoW is one of, if not the, most successful game in history. To go the way of WoW would be like telling a grocery store they are going the way of Wal-Mart. Who would complain about that?

Also, you do not have years of sustained success because you got into something at the right time yet fail to yield a good product. LoL has been on top for what, years? That's not a fluke borne of some "we got lucky and copied stuff at the right time in gaming history" crap. 

Also, to bring integrity into the argument means nothing. A lack of integrity does not mean you lack the business acumen or product knowledge to still produce top tier results. They don't go hand in hand. You could look at the tournament payouts, but that's silly. If a tournament is bigger and makes more income, yet pays less out to contestants, how is that dumb from a business perspective? Could you imagine if Jeapordy only had to give out a few hundred dollars to the winner yet retained the same amount of viewers?  It would save money. 

You have some of the worst arguments that I've come across. But please continue to preach about how dumb this company that raked in $1.6 billion in revenue in 2015 is so stupid. Maybe you have some insight as to how they can fix all these errors?

Edit: had to correct some iPhone brevity issues. Typing long paragraphs on phones is a pain.

"A lack of integrity does not mean you have business acumen or product knowledge to still produce top tier results. They don't go hand in hand."

McDonalds is, or was for the longest time, the most successful franchise ever. Tell me, was it because their product was QUALITY? No. It was about marketing, and convenience.  

Just because Riot makes money doesn't mean the product is quality or good for a competitive eSport. The quality is shit, and will continue to be shit until they are forced to make changes due to market changes.  For example, they way McDonalds had to add in healthy options like oatmeal and shit to meet the changing demand in the market.  Riot is like McDonalds. Just a crap product marketed correctly.

But you're comparing apples and oranges. McDonald's sells food which is a necessity. You're forced to buy it and eat it. The motivators that factor in to one's food choices is vastly different than the motivators that factor in to one's entertainment choices. 

McDonald's is known for convenience (quick drive through and an easy menu) and cost efficiency (hello full belly on $4). Those things are important when you're talking about food. Not as much when you're looking at video games. 

LoL can't be much more accessible than they are now. I mean, they could launch a platform based thing, or make the game able to be played from a mobile device, but that's not really a feasible solution to increasing convenience. It's not like other games are heavily gated through layers of hoops to jump through and play a game and LoL is able to be double-clicked and you're playing. 

Also, the other big one is affordability. All the big mobas have a slightly different pay structure and LoL is actually one of the harshest from what I've seen. (I've never played DOTA or Overwatxh or anything. I've played a little Smite.) You get a handful of free champions and have to pay to unlock permanently usable champs. You can either farm IP for years, or you can pay some steep RP prices. Yet people still continue to sign up, buy champs, skins, lottery boxes, etc. 

You can't even say people just go with what their comfortable with. (Another great thing about McDonald's. You know exactly what you're getting when you go there minus when they remove spicy mcchickens from the menu those bastards!) Lol's player count has only continued to grow and grow. They aren't just retaining players, they are gaining players. 

The real reason that people complain about the state of the game/champs/autofill/BS items/weak towers/etc. boils down to one very particular fact....

You can't keep 100 million people happy. No matter what you do to balance it or fix toxicity issues or try to improve things, you will NEVER please 100 million people. 

The unhappy ones run to the boards to complain about how stupid Riot is for doing X thing that pissed them off.

Stop kidding yourself. There a handful of OP champs, and champs that are banned nearly every match.  This is so far from being balanced its laughable. A truly balanced game would see greater variety of team comps because the advantage of one champion over another would not be so pronounced as it is now. This would make for more interesting games. And you would see a greater distribution of champions that are banned.  To say that the complaints are just the wanking of the masses takes away any possibility of looking at whether or not Riot is screwing up? 

Was it wrong when all the unhappy ones came to boards for a year demanding Solo Que back, after Marc Merrill condescendingly explained to us all why we were wrong? 

Was it wrong for us to keep nagging Riot to give us a sandbox mode after they made it clear they didnt want to make one?

Should we have no complained about how strong the reworked Poppy was?

The list can go on and on. SO many decision that were objectively bad, that Riot later had to correct.Sometimes months or a year later, despite the fact that the customers...ie you and me and the rest of us, knew immediately the decision was bad. 

So don't tell me that Riot knows what they are doing. Just because each individual who works at Riot might be good at their job, it doesn't mean that they are being pulled together with good leadership or that the way teams communicate with each other is good enough.  Maybe that is why the game is constantly unbalanced. OR MAYBE they do it on purpose. But at this point you are choosing between incompetence or purposeful deception

Sadly, I can see no point in explaining things to you. There's always going to be OP champs and underperforming ones. That's what happens when you balance for 100 million people in a wide range of individual ability. If a champ is OP at Bronze level, it may be completely obsolete at Challenger level. How do you balance that perfectly? As soon as a champ is brough back down, another takes its place. Remove Poppy, open the door for Maoki. It never ends. 

But yeah, Riot is so stupid because they go back and try to fix mistakes they made or eventually re-work issues that are complained about and their testing and data back up. How dare those dumb monkeys not get it right the first time? Their lack of teamwork and leadership sure shine through when they have to fix something.
I can see that you are all in for Riot. Good job, drone.

Yes, because I think it's a logical fallacy that a company that made $1.6 billion in 2015 and has over 100 million players a month doesn't know what they're doing, I'm clearly a drone. 

Pro tip for your future debating career: when you are trying to prove a point, facts/stats go much further than a subjective viewpoint.
Here in Europe, McDonald's costs a LOT (full European belly for 11€) and it is still as bad and successful.

What part of Europe? I used to live in Italy. It has a very high cost of living, so 11€ is a bit different in terms of what you're going to get. For example, I would go to the malls and rarely be able to find a good pair of new shoes for under 100€, but here I can get them for $50. 

Besides, if McDonald's (or LoL) is able to produce an inferior quality product, yet market it and be so successful with it, I don't think it makes them dumb. It's contradictory towards the initial argument of "X has no clue what they're doing." Maybe they know exactly what they're doing? Sustained success is not a fluke or an outlier.

Have you ever played wow?

Wow was the best game ever made until mr ghostcrawler put his hands on it. Yes, it was AMAZING, untill this game designer started to design. From this very moment on (aberrations in classes design, dungeon finder, raid composition,... all a product of his work) everything that was worth to be played in this game, everything that made this game great started to dissapear.

People said that there would never be a wow killer. Ladies, gentlemen, you are in front of the true wow killer.

Ask whoever you want what's the wow they love, everybody will tell you the same, **vanilla-burning crusade all-day-long**. Then the designer started to "design".

Wow was what it was, and ghostcrawler had NOTHING to do with it. Since it peaked before he arrived to blizzard. When did Lol peak? when did he come to riot? make your maths dude.

Ok, this is something that applies to everything. There is a "soft cap" on the amount of people that you will be able to bring in and retain. WoW was in its heyday like a year or so after Ghostcrawler went there. It was a subscriber base that was never going to be sustained. Every game hits a peak and then goes down from there. Regardless of who was at the helm, WoW was not going to retain their 12+ million subscribers. It's the same for LoL. They will not retain their peak numbers. That's why it's a peak. 

Also, people always seem to have this nostalgic memory of things they did in the past. This isn't just with games, but holds especially true with games. Think of it as a relationship. In the beginning you get those "everything is new" butterfly feelings and it's oh so sweet. But after years of the same game, that new feeling goes away. Yeah there may be new classes and dungeons or game modes or whatnot, but that's like wearing different makeup or dying your hair. It's still the same thing with a different look. Things are always better when they're new. 

Now you point to Ghostcrawler as the reason WoW went downhill but you're missing the fact that it peaked about a year after he went to Blizzard. Now you can try and say that it was his predecessor's projects that lead to the continued growth after he took over as lead there, but then there's the fact that the game got a huge boost in subscriptions about a year after he left to LoL. Those are projects that he would have been involved in and help to cultivate. 

On top of that, while Ghostcrawler was with WoW during its years of initial decline, it was a slow downward trend. After he left and the new expansion quickly fizzled out, subs dropped like crazy. Perhaps if he had been there, the decline would not have been so steep. 

As to LoL and it's numbers, Ghostcrawler took over at the beginning of 2014. By like every metric that I've seen, LoL has done nothing but continue to grow and become the largest game in the world. That's with Ghostcrawler having been in charge for 3 years. 

I'm not saying everything he touches is gold, but the guy has a good track record everywhere he's been. When people bash him and blame him for ruining the game that they love, it's doing nothing more than scapegoating.

The "all specs viable" rework, that was UTTER GARBAGE dude.

The transmog, what the f* is this sh*?

I just objectively ~~hate ~~ disagree with any idea this guy had for the game and I objectively think that this guy did no good to the game. Easy as that, 100% objective.
100% objective?  Yeah...  and I'm the Virgin Mary.
Come on, tell me that dungeon finder, all specs viable rework and transmog were greats improvements in the game. I want to have some laugh.

Personally, I'm more of a hardcore traditionalist. I'm a huge fan of open world PvP and walking your happy ass to the front of a dungeon to go inside. My favorite MMO of all time was DAoC and as crappy as those 20 minute horse rides were, I love the work it takes to meet up with a group to go into a dungeon. Stuff like dungeon finder are QoL changes that appeal to a much broader fan base. That's necessary for sustainment. 

Also, who the hell hates transmog?!?  You can choose not to use it and you'll never be affected. Or you could use it and have your favorite looking armor and weapons on items that are actually relevant. 

Interesting side note on how the initial WoW was a work of art...  Many of the original designers of WoW left to go create their own game. Don't know if you heard about the much-hyped and very short-lived Wildstar...  but it isn't exactly the WoW killer it was supposed to be. Why weren't the designers able to keep the massive player base that flocked to the new game?

Because GC came to blizz as a lead designer?

" Stuff like dungeon finder are QoL changes that appeal to a much broader fan base" No, the proof is that once they followed this road they did nothing but to lose players base, up to lose nearly 8 million players if I remember correctly, easy to say that.

GC left, and they kind of made some changes, people say player base grew, but, honestly, I dont care anymore.

Transmog was USELESS. That's the kind of ideas he has. The best of all of them, is useless. The worst? destroy the game.

In guessing you meant to reply to me. Clearly this is going round and round and you won't agree with facts and statistics so this will be my last response. 

You didn't really do the numbers properly on the 5 mil lost subs. When GC went to WoW they had a sub amount of about 10.7 million. When he left it was around 7.8 million. You can't say he was only responsible for the decline of subscriptions. It's not a one way street. 

Also, you say xmog is a waste of time. News flash: unless you're a pro or a streamer who uses it as a source of income, all games are just a waste of time. They create alternative worlds in which we can enjoy playing something that is designed to be fun. Just because you don't like wasting your time looking for cool xmogs, and would rather waste your time with PvP doesn't make it any less valuable to the game. 

And no you cannot show off the same without the xmog. Many cool xmog sets are like achievements. It might show off by saying "I ran through this shit dungeon like 500 times to finally get the pauldrons I needed to complete the set! I'm dedicated!"

I still fail to see any solid evidence that you are basing your argument on. You keep saying GC ruined it and he fucked everything up, but all you've mentioned is how they introduced dungeon finder and xmog. 

Anyways, I'm done because this is going nowhere. I'd rather play LoL than obsess about how someone is behind the curtain pulling strings and actively destroying the game through incompetence.

Since ghostcrawler started to ghostcrawl until he left they lost 5 million (not 8, right, "only" 5) out of 12.

Vanity in wow (at least transmog related) has nothing to do with "cool stuff", it didnt work the same way it works in LoL. Thunderfury was not cool because it was cool, but because what you had to  do to get it. "Scarab Lord" was not cool because people wanted to be the lord of the scarabs, that's for sure. Any wow player whould have riden the amani bear 1000 times better than any payed mount if he wanted to show off.

Transmog? pff, well, fine, kind of a waste of time. You can show off exactly the same without transmog, since transmog doesnt give you nothing actually but to save a couple of slots in your bank.

To keep people busy? yes, probably if they hadnt fucked up the game, people would have had something to do instead of collecting stupid stuff and wouldnt have left the game, isnt it ghostcrawler?

In the 2 quarters before dungeon finder the game last approx 900k subscriptions. In the 2 quarters after, they lost another roughly 900k subscriptions. This was after WoW's peak and they were already losing subs but it did not accelerate that rate at all. Nowhere near 8 million. 

Also, you think transmog is useless, but that's purely from a gameplay standpoint. You're not thinking about what it brings them on the back end as another cool "feature" that people can do. It's also something to hunt for and stay occupied rather than letting the game get stale. 

Skins in League over no (except for the few that are banned in pro play) competitive advantage yet Riot makes hundreds of millions of dollars a year selling them. Cosmetic things aren't so useless. Do you disagree?
Because capitalism is NOT meritocratic.
